chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Noell H Ryder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case settlement

Defendant Noell H Ryder in court with attorney James H Krave.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF51, 16TR315, 16TR577.  Agreement has been reached in this all matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record. 

16TR315-DE will enter a plea of NC, order will order a fine of $811.50, 6 months revocation of DL, $22.90 restitution, AODA assessment, 6 points on driving record. 
16TR577-DRI

16CF50-Ct 1 will be DRI
             Ct 2-NC-court accepts, guilty
Sentence will be withheld, one year probation, CC, DNA sample and surcharge, follow any recommendations by DOC agent.

Defendant Noell H Ryder in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Noell H Ryder in custody.  Heard along with 16CF51. James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond.  DE has posted a cash bond previously.  $2500.00 sign bond, concurrent,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  No possession of unprescribed medications, all prescirbed medications must remain in original containers, and be taken only as directed by physician.  DE must go to Aurora today and sign up for treatment program,  treatment plan will be provided to Atty and District Attorney.  DE will waive time limits for PH, court instructs on waiver of time limits, will accept waiver.  Set for PH 5-17-16 @ 2:00PM.  DE intends to go to the lighthouse today with the help of DHHS.
